body.name: Tinukim iFeed 4 Ounce Self Feeding Baby Bottle with Tube - Handless Anti-Colic Nursing System, Pink - 2-Pack
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 20 hrs 27 mins
features: Soft Latch-On Nipple: The Tinukim iFeed Self-Feeding Baby Bottle with Tube - Anti-Colic Nursing System promotes proper latch, reduces nursing spills, and mimics natural breastfeeding—perfect for babies and moms who want to switch between breastfeeding and bottle feeding
Leak-Free Venting Technology: Reduces air build-up associated with colic; also helps reduce gassiness, ear infection, and spit-up

Portable & Easy to Use: Features a wide mouth, rounded edges, and clearly marked measurements for ease of use, and easy fill-up and cleanup. Portable set includes: 2 bottles, 2 adaptors, 2 disks, 2 nipples, 4 cap rings, 2 (6.5") tubes, 2 tubes (11.5"), 2 nipple covers, and 1 tube cleaning brush
Non-Toxic Design: Made with high-quality silicone—free of BPAs, phthalates, PVC, and lead
Durable Construction: Safe to use in microwaves, freezers, dishwashers, boiling water and sterilizers; heat resistant up to 392˚F
body.description: The Tinukim iFeed Self-Feeding Baby Bottle with Tube - Anti-Colic Nursing System is an ingenious, handless feeding system designed to let you comfortably feed your little one in an upright position.This no-hands feeding device is tailor-made for babies 3 months and up and their busy, on-the-go families. Say goodbye to inconvenient feeding times/situations and to dropped bottles, and feed your baby anywhere on the go—while baby is in the carrier, carriage, stroller, or car seat.The controlled, air-flow design allows baby to easily regulate and manage feed pacing and flow amount. The Tinukim iFeed Handless Nursing System is a portable, two-pack set that contains:2 bottles, 2 adaptors, 2 disks, 2 nipples, 4 cap rings, 2 (6.5") tubes, 2 (11.5") tubes, 2 nipple covers, and 1 tube cleaning brush. Baby bottles are available in two sizes: 4 oz. and 9 oz. and three colors: Blue, Pink, and White. Limited one-year manufacturer’s warranty. Imported.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far our favorite bottles!
reviews.reviewText: Love that we can sit her up and not have to hold the bottle

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: it’s almost impossible for baby to suck the milk through and it leads to frustration and crying. i had to start the bottle for her so many times and spit the milk out just to get some in the nipple

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great idea but could've been done differently
reviews.reviewText: I love the concept of the idea. A hands free approach and to help babies 4+ months to learn to use their hands and gain some control on their own feedings. Even it's just to learn some hand control.Now here are the cons on the product. Again I love the concept of the idea, but I think it could've been executed differently. In a way it was created poorly. First of all whomever created the product didn't place in mind how much time it takes for parents to wash this item. You have 2x tubes short and long, you have 2x caps one for the bottle and one for the nipple, 1x nipple, 1x bottle, 1x cap, 1x adapter to the nipple, 1x disk adapter for the bottle, and 1× silicone disk. That's 10 different parts if you break it all down. I timed myself when properly washing this product, and let's just say I could've washed 4 different bottles with the amount of time I had to use to wash this product. To use on the go yes it's great but to set it up again and having to wash it, gets tiring. Seriously what parent has the time to wash just one of these bottles? Even though my child has her dad and myself. With other chores in the house and baby having her needs met, it's just not worth it. I have a better way to approach this idea, but I would have the company reach out to me if they wish to know.Either way great idea 💡 👍 Just poorly executed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my granddaughter for her great for my great grandson and she really likes him as she can suck without getting the air and she can let beside him while she’s doing dishes or whatever while he’s eating he’s still a little young so she hold the bottle for him she really likes them

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: They are very convenient however, cleaning out the straw(tubes) can be difficult.Overall, it’s worth buying

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Hard to use
reviews.reviewText: My daughter had a hard time using these, it was hard for her to get the formula sucked up to the nipple. We only used a few times but not worth the money. Also leaks unless sitting up!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a game-changer. Some physics knowledge required.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I was spending literally hours per feed on my 4 week old, who would go through growth spurts of downing two 4 oz bottles consecutively, but required a slow flow nipple due to her size. My wrists were hurting, and I would frequently create makeshift props for bottles when I needed to reach or grab for something. Then I stumbled across this amazingness.Some assembly required, but it's pretty straightforward and comes with a diagram. I wish it would have been more clear on the parts, though, and what each one does. For example, it did not describe the nipples.Comes with four Nipples, one each of:Size 1Size 2Size 5Size 8Seems the size 1 nipple is for bottle feeding without the tubing (this can be used like a regular bottle as well). I tested each out by sucking on them myself; when attached to the tubing, even I had difficulty creating enough suction to get fluid up the size 1 nipple.I ended up using the size 8 nipple for my newborn. I was concerned with air trapped in the tubing and nipple (see videos), so I went ahead and sucked out the air myself until the tubing and nipple were filled with formula, and then rinsed off the nipple tip before giving to my newborn.The bottle says for use with infants who can sit up only (3 months+) but it works well with my baby when she's propped up - just be sure bottle us level with her mouth to prevent siphoning effect.Also, make sure the tubing end us IN FORMULA (duh-like a straw) or else she will suck in air. Anyways, I'm thrilled. :)
